To: Montabella Families

From: Shelly Millis, Superintendent

RE: Calendar Change

The calendar for the 20-21 school year has a slight change since the original publication. Several early release dates have been eliminated. The orginal calendar had early release days that were scheduled back to back so that required teacher professional development could take place in the afternoons. The new calendar will reflect a full day of teacher professional development where students do not report to school and the following day will be a regular (full) day of school. The only early release days that remain on the calendar will be in December (end of semester), March (conferences) and May (last day of school). The updated calendar is attached for your reference. We apologize for the late change in schedule but hope that this more consistent release time will benefit families.

From the Desk of Athletic Director, Mr. Weese,

This year, the MHSAA has waived the annual requirement of a sports physical, provided some things are completed and there was no significant change in health in the student-athlete.

Any student coming into 7th grade and didn't have a sports physical from last year, will still need to schedule a sports physical (please do it soon) prior to participating in any athletic activities. If the student completed a sports physical last year (2019-2020) and the form was turned into the school office, a questionnaire is all that is required. *Note - significant medical changes may require a new physical. Additionally, if a parent wants their student(s) to get a new sports physical, you can do that as well.

Follow the link for more detailed information and attached forms:

https://montabellamustangs.com/2020/07/02/sports-physical-news-forms-attached/

If you have any questions, please contact mweese@montabella.com and I will get back to you with an answer.

Montabella Community,
We have an opportunity to celebrate our seniors. The senior class will be doing a "senior cruise" from the school down Wyman Rd to Edmore and then through the traditional homecoming parade route. This will start at approximately 6:00 PM on May 17 at the school. If you want to help recognize the class of 2020, you can park alongside the roads of the route. Honk those horns and cheer them on. You should also crank up 106.3 WGLM at the same time and listen to a special show dedicated to our seniors, with messages from staff members and specially selected songs. For the safety of everyone we are asking that you please do not come to the school during this time. You should also remain in your cars and practice good social distancing. However, the Montabella Community can still make some noise to recognize our seniors. See you on the route!

Today we had a special visitor, she brought tears as she told her story. For some, it was uncomfortably hard. To think about the what-ifs, to put oneself in her shoes, it was HARD. To have someone stand before you and describe a life that you can relate to and then hear that in an instant, one irrational decision could have ended a seemingly happy adolescent life was heavy. Suicide prevention is important, and we want to help remove the stigma of mental illness. It’s okay to not be okay! It’s okay to ask for help! There is hope!

Thank you, Shandy Longcore, for visiting Montabella Community Schools and sharing your story.

Crisis hotline: 1-800-273-TALK
Text for a licensed counselor: 741741

“Don’t forget the power that you have!”

#YoureStoryIsntOver;
#EmbracingImperfections

Applications are now being accepted to host a High School Exchange Student for the next school year. By signing up now, get that extra time to bond through text and video chats before the student arrives. Contact Lisa with Greenheart Exchange at 989-287-1350 or email lisagreenheart@gmail.com to learn more about the program and the application process. Hosting is exciting and real, it allows you to add to your family in ways hard to explain. This organization brings students from 45-60 different countries each year currently. Call Lisa today, she can tell you about students (looking to connect now with a family) from Brazil, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Poland, Thailand and more. Students and different countries are being added weekly to this very fulfilling program.
